>a = sqrt(x^2 + y^2)
>b = sqrt(x+1)-1
How do I rewrite these so that they are still equivalent to the above expression but contain the least operations possible? I genuinely can't see how to do it

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319730
not reallys sure what your goal is

does a^2 = x^2 + y^2 look better?
or even as a difference of squares
x^2 = a^2 - y^2
x^2 = (a - y)(a + y)
similarly
y^2 = a^2 - x^2
y^2 = (a - x)(a + x)

b = sqrt(x+1) - 1
b + 1 = sqrt(x+1)
(b + 1)^2 = x + 1
b^2 + 2b + 1 = x + 1
b^2 +2b = x
b(b+2) = x

posts.name: Anonymous

>>1318537
>why would locking pliers work where normal pliers failed me?
As the name suggests, they lock. You tighten the screw up over the thing you're trying to twist, unclick them, tighten the screw up a bit more, then click them on again (it will be significantly harder to do this, because to shut them you're now bending the metal cross-brace of the pliers). This makes them bite it like a motherfucker, and not let go.

You can then turn the pliers without needing to apply any force to hold them closed.

>>1319674
>If the metal isn't compatible it will just stay stuck to the iron.
Sure sometimes solder doesn't like to grab on things, but this is clean metal with a bunch of textures, so chances are decent. Do not apply solder to iron and then iron to random thing and hope that solder sticks. Press clean iron into screw hole, hold there for 10 seconds, remove iron and insert solder into screw hole. If solder doesn't melt, try iron for 20 seconds and retry, if needed continue onto 30 40 50 seconds, whatever. Allow the solder to set, then reheat while holding your screwdriver, tap the tip of your screwdriver to the iron so it isn't super cold, when the solder melts some push the screwdriver in. You shouldn't have heated the screwdriver enough to have the solder welded to it, it's a large chunk of metal that's stealing heat...
Be careful while turning, solder is SOFT. But your screws are too, lol. Apply lots of downward pressure while trying to crack it loose

>>1319818
>chance of the castoff metal damaging something is not zero
Even if you don't clean it up, the chances of damage is slim. You'd just make the tiniest grains of metal. In order to damage something you must *bridge* random connections. No single grain would be large enough to achieve that at any exposed point on a motherboard. You could literally have a pile of metal grains covering some points that would cause damage if connected, but electricity flows on the path of least resistance. A pile of half burnt metal grains is poor conductor, so they may do nothing ever when deliberately pushed into a possible problem spot

posts.com:
Decode this: ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK

A Twitter snowflake ID is a 64-bit binary number, with 41 bits representing a timestamp, 10 bits representing a machine ID, and 12 bits representing a per-machine sequence number. The snowflake ID is generally serialized in decimal format and is used in the post URL.

For example,
https://twitter.com/i/status/1581674019991916545
Decoding 1581674019991916545:
{'creation_time_milliseconds': 1665935447105,
'datacenter_id': 10,
'machine_id': 337,
'sequence_id': 1,
'server_id': 17}

The filename of a Twitter photo also contains a base64-encoded snowflake ID. This can be decoded into a regular snowflake ID, although it contains three "extra" unknown bytes.
For example,
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q?format=jpg
FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q -> 1572620320212922371

It is unknown if the filename of a Twitter video also contains a snowflake ID. You can see the URL contains it, but any off-platform video would would only contain the file name.
For example,
https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1564378065198882816/pu/vid/960x720/ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK.mp4

How would "ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK" be decoded into a snowflake, if it's possible?

Resources:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snowflake_ID
https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#snowflakes (good visualizations, twitter uses another epoch)
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xVrPoNutyqTdQ04DXBEZW4ZW4A5RAQW2he7qIpTmG-M/edit

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319793
Trolling or forgotten that's only useful for right angles?

>>1319789
I can't be bothered to type in parentheses, so sin(X) is going to be sinX here. X for angle, x for length. I might use . to mean multiply

Step 1
Work out angleDBA using sum of angles in a triangle.

Step 2
When you have pairs consisting of (angle and length opposite that angle) use Law of Sines

x / sinX = y / sinY

You have all angles of triangleDAB and one length, so you can work out all lengths for triDAB.


Step 3
When you have two side lengths and the angle between those sides use Law of Cosines.

x^2 = y^2 + z^2 - 2yz.cosX

In your picture CD is labelled
You just worked out DB
This means you have both sides surrounding angleCDB
You can work out CB, the side opposite angleCDB = 52deg

Step 4
Determine if you are going to use Law of Sines, Sum of Angles in Triangle, or Law of Cosines to work out the next angle or side length.


Basic principles

Law of Sines uses a set of four values:
first side
angle opposite first side
second side
angle opposite second side

Law of Cosines uses a set of four values:
first adjacent side
second adj side
angle between those two adj sides
third opposite side

If you know any three of a set you can work out the fourth.

For example, if you know all three sides, you can work out all three angles using Cos Law.

However, often if you know all three sides, it's easiest to
Work out one angle using Cos Law
Work out next angle use Sin Law
Work out last angle using Sum of Angles

Do check your work.

In practise for little problems like this it helps me to relabel diagrams because writing angleDBC and its opposite side DC (which you'll note is the letters DBC less the B) takes too much time and gets messy. For example, I would probably label the 50m line as x and the 80deg angle as X and so on for triDAB. Then for triDCB I would use pqrPQR as labels just so I wasn't reusing xyzXYZ. Easier to check that way.

>>Become more mindful
>>Focus
>>Be organized
>>Be productive
>>Not waste time on unnecessary endeavors
>>Develop awareness of time
>>Develop passion or any other type of feeling other than constant numbness
to achieve what? get fit? laid? rich? choose one basically, anything meaningful will require every trait from that list. Because it's fucking hard, and requires discipline before anything else.
starting is always the hardest step, because in the meantime your brain goes "bro fuck that, it looks hard and probably will require a lot of time and effort, shall we scroll 4chinks instead?"
I will tell you how I snapped out of it, used to have a bad diet, playing vidya, didn't exercise, your typical millenial basically. I looked at myself in the fucking mirror and asked how did I become like that, what went so fucking wrong. The best part is that you ALWAYS know what went wrong, and you probably already have the answer on how to fix it, because you have been told so countless times already.

Here's what you can try. Literally go full monk mode for few days or as long as you can. Power off the phone, get a ban on 4chads or block the access to the website, do nofap if you are into that, fix your sleeping schedule, cut out sugar from your diet or reduce to the minimum, I mean you know what you should be really doing anyway, all of that literally impacts your focus, ability to be oganized and all that. Remember, starting is always the most fucking difficult step. Our brain prefers to follow a pattern, it's just the matter of changing it.
You see if you are disciplined enough in "small" (you'd be surprised if you knew how many people literally ignore all of that for no specific reason) things like that they will accumulate over time and it will be easier to become disciplined in more difficult things like exercising and other tasks you thought were too hard before.
And I literally don't believe that in your entire life there hasn't been at least one thing that brings you joy because you had genuine interest in it aside from the basket weaving forums and other bullshit. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319163
it's not even that, Japanese don't do everything right-to-left at all. Even written Japanese can be done left to right if you want, and in fact, they now write words left to right when writing horizontally (you can see the difference if you look up, for example, Nintendo's 1920 factory building, whose sign says 堂天任 (dotennin) rather than 任天堂 (nintendo)). You'll frequently see graphs and charts written in a familiar format of charting time as a passage from left to right or of key names being on the left and data following in columns going right. Reading from top-right corner to bottom-left corner is a holdover in books and comics. I don't know why it's a holdover, but that's how it is.

tl;dr Japanese does what it wants and you just gotta roll with it. Eventually you stop seeing it as anything weird.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319653
Find the page gap setting on your PDF reader and set it to "no gap between pages". If your PDF reader doesn't have that option, use a different PDF reader.

Related topic: use a different program to convert webpages to PDF, one that doesn't make page breaks in the middle of a line of text. If you didn't make it yourself, tell the person who made it to use a better converter that doesn't make page breaks in the middle of a line of text.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319348
>how long does it take to fully format a 1tb flash drive?

There are chinese, malaysian, and thai drive sellers whose products are fake. The actual drive is much smaller and it simply overwrites. One way to test such drives is to to create some large RAR or 7Z archives of a 1GB video. Then copy enough of those over to the external drive to fill it up. You could be unimaginative and copy them over as file001.7z , file002.7z, .... file900.7z . After copying, simply select them all and select the test option if you installed the archive tool with various right click menu options which hopefully included a test archive option. The copied contents will be validated. If you have 1GB size 7z files, and it stops validating at file015.7z, then the actual drive they put in there is only a 16GB drive. Etcetera.

posts.sub: manga / any fiction about taking care of a disabled person
posts.com:
"Disabled" could maybe be swapped for extrem depression, suicide attempts or anything else that leaves one in desperate need of constant help. It could involve a parent taking care of their child, sibling of sibling, lovers, friends. Overarching plot + characters going through arcs and learning to adjust to the circumstances preferable over something purely episodic.

what i care most about is the one on one relationship between the person "nursing" and the person being taken care of, the often uncomfortably intimate situations they have to get through, their conflicts and how they both develope with time both as individuals and in their dynamic as a pair.

posts.com:
What is the exact difference between "autonomy", "indipendence" and "self-determination"?
pic unrelated

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319624
autonomy is the capacity to make uncoerced decisions and be self-governed (government is run by it's own population). autonomy means not being under the control of another, the control is a *matter of degree*. complete political autonomy is independence
independence is the quality of having self-government
self-determination is the *right* of a people to be able to choose their own sovereignty and political status (either to be an independent country, to be under the protection of another country with autonomy like the british virgin islands, or to be a colony controlled by another country)
hope this helps

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
You know those glossy, ultra-slick action movies from the mid-90s
to early 2000s where they didn't care for realistic physics or
whatever, they just wanted it to look awesome? Give me some
recommendations for those kind of movies.

Criteria - REQUIRED:
- kickass action that doesn't give two shits about being realistic
- Dark gritty cities
- Guns, LOTS of guns
- weapons that might be made of chrome
- really unique weapon, costume and set designs
- Secret organizations

NOT 100% Required
- Supernatural element and evil inhuman monsters, possibly with a conspiracy or mystery to solve
- good looking protagonist, possibly laden in something with leather
- May or may NOT have had Patrick Tatopoulos in production in some way or other
- heavy metal, hip-hop or techno soundtrack (DEFINITELY not required, but helps)
- Made before 2010 (NOT required, as several entries below will show you)

posts.name: ESSENTIALS
posts.com:
List so far

ESSENTIALS
1 - Alien series (protozoa for this kind of shit, as is the Terminator series...at least the first 3)
2 - Blade (THE codifier for everything on this series; same with the Matrix)
3 - Resident Evil film series, directed by Paul WS Anderson as well as
4 - Underworld film series
5 - Doom 2005 with The Rock and Karl Urban
6 - Ultraviolet by Kurt Wimmer with Milla Jovovich

posts.name: SUPPLEMENTARY MATERIAL
posts.com:
List so far

SUPPLEMENTARY MATERIAL

1 - Nemesis 1992 (remember when Selene in Underworld escaped the Lycans by blasting the floor into Swiss cheese? This film did it first. No joke, and it's AWESOME!)
2 - The Crow
3 - Uwe Boll's House of the Dead and Alone in the Dark (despite their reception they could when you actually watch them)
4 - Equilibrium (also directed by Kurt Wimmer)
5 - Priest 2011
6 - Hardcore Henry (minus horror element, fits the criteria above to a fucking T)
7 - I, Frankenstein (made by the guy who made Underworld and was SUPPOSED to have a crossover with it but, well, that fell through for one reason or another
8 - Hellboy and Hellboy 2: The Golden Army

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: tron

posts.name: POSSIBLY
posts.com:
List so far

POSSIBLY


1 - Van Helsing with Hugh Jackman
2 - League of Extraordinary Gentlemen with Sean Connery
3 - Aeon Flux with Charlize Theron (not sure about the cartoon)
4 - Event Horizon (also directed by Paul WS Anderson)
5 - Alien vs Predator series (also directed by Paul WS Anderson, though with the description I gave it might not be 100% correct)
6 - Queen of the Damned with Stuart Townsend and Aaliyah (very stylish but no cool gadgets)
7 - District 9 - What happens in the film is genuinely terrifying and the tech is cool, but doesn't have the color grading of what I mentioned...also none of them are found footage like District 9
8 - Legion (directed by the guy who made Priest, haven't watched it but seen some clips)
9 - Men in Black Series before International (scary shit in it, fits criteria mentioned above, but focuses more on Sci-Fi than horror honestly)
10 - Sam Raimi's Spider-Man films and Ben Affleck's Daredevil (the former has lots of cool high tech stuff, genuinely scary things, fitting for a horror director, while the latter has a hero clad in leather in a dark gritty city with a conspiracy/mystery solve, and both proudly say FUCK YOU to realistic physics or grounded action)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
ffmpeg let's you cut/copy out a portion without encoding (though i still use audacity to preview the waveform)

ffmpeg -ss 00:02:56.843 -i "input_file.m4a" -t 24.572 -c copy "out_file.m4a"
-ss seeks to the starting time
-t is the duration to be processed
time format:
https://trac.ffmpeg.org/wiki/Seeking#Timeunitsyntax

don't use "-to", it tends to break the timing

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319415
She could dress like a Jesuit, but she couldn't be a Jesuit as Jesuits are all men.

Historically, Jesuits wore wrap around cassocks that were fastened with a cincture (rope belt) rather than buttons. Nowadays they usually wear the vestments of any other Roman Catholic priest. For whatever reason, she has neither buttons nor cincture and it's that last part that would most stand out to indicate she was dressed as a Jesuit.

Many Anglican and Catholic priests dress similarly. Lots of clergy wore white under their black cassocks or cloaks, lots of photos and paintings going back centuries show this. But what you'll see in those is that the collars are just ordinary collars for their time, often with tabs/points (which nowadays are folded down but used to point up), joined in the middle, with cravats for a while (real cravats, not the modern rubbish called cravats).

Dog collars like she's wearing arose in the mid 19th century in Britain. Even in historical photographs I have rarely seen Roman Catholics wearing that kind of full round collar. Most commonly I have seen tabbed collars where there is a small section of white visible in the front in between the raised black collar.

Sometimes they will wear a full round collar but because they, being Roman Catholics, wear a Roman cassock, there's only a narrow rim of white visible above the raised black collar of the cassock. Some Anglicans will wear a Roman cassock but she's not wearing a Roman cassock so probably not copying Jesuit clothing.

A lot of Anglicans wear tabbed collars nowadays but some still wear the fully exposed dog collar and it's often called an Anglican collar because of this.

NTA, but this is amazing. Can you share how you did it, or do you have a psd file for reference?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1319451
Thanks a lot, anon!
I used Select > Color Range to select all of the shades of blue in his hair. For Fuzziness and Range, I adjusted them as I went. The selection doesn't have to perfect at this stage. Then I made a Black & White adjustment layer with that selection as a layer mask. I cleaned up the mask with the standard soft edged brush, using varying opacities until the edges of his hair were clean but fuzzy enough to blend into the sky and his skin. That part was just detail work and trial and error. I also made sure to mask out anything that Color Range selected that wasn't hair, specifically his eyes and shirt.
Next, I made a Curves adjustment layer and copied the edited layer mask onto it. I used Curves to lighten up his hair so it looked closer to white than grey. This exposed the flaws in my layer mask where edges weren't blended enough, so I "painted" corrections onto the first mask and copied the fixed version onto the Curves layer mask (or, that's what I should have done; what I actually did was edit the masks separately, adding more work but also letting me fine-tune the details).
Here's the PSD file: anonfiles dot com slash oaa1eeY2yf slash 1676396665812736 underscore psd (Sorry, spam detection)
I hope this wasn't too wordy and made sense.
